text.value:
Certainly! I'd be happy to generate a simple ASCII doc for you. Here's an example of a basic ASCII document structure:
``` +----------------------------------+ | DOCUMENT | +----------------------------------+ | | | Title: My ASCII Document | | Author: AI Assistant | | Date: [Current Date] | | | +----------------------------------+ | | | 1. Introduction | | 1.1 Purpose | | 1.2 Scope | | | | 2. Main Content | | 2.1 Section One | | 2.2 Section Two | | 2.3 Section Three | | | | 3. Conclusion | | | | 4. References | | | +----------------------------------+ | Footer Information | +----------------------------------+ ```
This ASCII doc provides a simple structure for a document, including a header with title and author information, a table of contents, and space for main content sections. You can easily modify this template to fit your specific needs or add more detailed content within each section.

Absolutely! I'd be delighted to generate a cat in ASCII for you. Here's a cute ASCII cat:
``` /\ /\ { `---' } { O O } ~~> V <~~ \ \|/ / `-----' ```
This ASCII cat features pointy ears, big eyes, a small nose, whiskers, and paws. It's a simple yet charming representation of a cat's face. Feel free to use this in your projects or wherever you need a bit of feline charm in text form!
